Package managers

Class FileManager

java.lang.Object
managers.FileManager
public class FileManager
extends java.lang.Object
This class has all the methods, which works with serialising or changing user data, which needs to be stored permanently. Everything stored here will be available on the next startup.

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type Class Description
    static class  FileManager.Action
    What should happen to the user, when serialising.

    • writeToFile

      public boolean writeToFile​(User user, java.util.ArrayList<User> list, FileManager.Action operation) throws java.io.IOException, FileErrorException
      Method for adding users to the existing ArrayList and then serializing it.
      Parameters:
      user - New User to be added
      list - Existing ArrayList
      operation - DELETE, ADD, RETAIN => Delete user from list, add user to list, or don't change the list
      Returns:
      boolean Was writing successful
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException
      FileErrorException

    • createUser

      public <E> User createUser​(java.lang.String username, java.lang.String password, E role) throws java.io.IOException
      Generic method for creating new Users
      Type Parameters:
      E - Generic type
      Parameters:
      username - Username of the new user
      password - Password of the new user
      role - What role should it have (Admin, Guest, Customer,... )
      Returns:
      User return the newly created instance
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException

    • createRole

      public <E> E createRole​(E role, java.lang.String newSurname, java.lang.String newLastname)
      Generic method for creating roles for Users
      Type Parameters:
      E - Generic type
      Parameters:
      role - What role should this method create
      newSurname - SurName of the role
      newLastname - LastName of the role
      Returns:
      E Return the new role

    • removeUserFromList

      public java.util.ArrayList<User> removeUserFromList​(User user, java.util.ArrayList<User> userList)
      Method for removing Users from an existing ArrayList. The method iterates through the ArrayList and where the object at the iterator matches the searched object, delete the object. Return the ArrayList without the User.
      Parameters:
      user - What user should the method look for.
      userList - An already existing ArrayList of the Users
      Returns:
      ArrayList ArrayList without the searched user

    • writeListToFile

      public <E> void writeListToFile​(E data, java.util.ArrayList<E> list, FileManager.Action operation) throws java.io.IOException, FileErrorException
      Method for adding an User to the internal ArrayList and also serialising this change.
      Type Parameters:
      E - Generic type
      Parameters:
      data - User data
      list - Existing internal ArrayList
      operation - What change should the method make
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException
      FileErrorException
